name: Narrow Grip Bench Press
how_to_perform:
1. Lie on a flat bench with your feet planted firmly on the ground and hold a narrow grip bar with your hands slightly narrower than shoulder-width apart.

2. Engage your core by pulling your belly button towards your spine, ensuring that your hips do not sag or pike upwards throughout the movement.

3. Lower the bar to your chest by bending your elbows, keeping them close to your body as you lower yourself.

4. Push the bar upwards, extending your arms fully and squeezing your chest muscles at the top of the movement.

5. Lower the bar back down to your chest, focusing on using your chest muscles to control the movement.

6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
short_summary: The narrow grip bench press is a variation of the traditional bench press that targets the chest muscles and requires a narrower hand position than standard grip, typically with hands about thumb-width apart.
